alert.note: Alert for Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 1:16PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHWEST SUFFOLK... NORTHWEST SUFFOLK...NORTHERN NASSAU...AND SOUTHERN NASSAU COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers which can reduce visibility to a mile or less at times. The precipitation may start as rain before changing over. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 113 PM EST, a band of snow showers was along a line extending from New Rochelle to near Sandy Hook and moving east at 45 MPH. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...Little to no accumulation is expected. THIS BAND OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE NEAR... Valley Stream and Glen Cove around 120 PM EST. Long Beach and Westbury around 125 PM EST. Freeport and Syosset around 130 PM EST. Levittown and Plainview around 135 PM EST. Huntington Station and Northport around 140 PM EST. Commack and Deer Park around 145 PM EST. Babylon around 150 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk
